headline.main: CHINESE CONTINUE GAINS IN CHEKIANG; Capture a Village Eight Miles From Kinhwa, Site of Field for Bombings of Tokyo NANCHANG STILL PRESSED U.S. Fliers Again Bomb Base at Myitkyina, Burma -- Five Fires Are Started

lead_paragraph: CHUNGKING, Sept. 1 (U.P.) -- Chinese troops have captured a railway village eight miles east of Kinhwa, site of a "bomb Tokyo" air base, and the Japanese garrison there has fired the town and is counter-attacking in three directions in an attempt to escape encirclement, it was reported tonight.
abstract: Chinese hold Lanchi, Tangki and Lungyu
